text:
Chronic upper lobe cavitary lung disease.
 Chronic upper lobe cavitary lung disease may be caused by infections, emphysema, cystic fibrosis, lung cancer, sarcoidosis and rheumatologic syndromes.
 The diagnostic evaluation includes a complete history, a physical examination, a chest radiograph, and sputum examination and culture.
 In some cases, computed tomographic scanning and biopsy are required.
